p: There are two major arms of the RAS, one arm, the Angiotensin II (Ang II)-Ang II type 1 receptor (AT 1R) pathway is pro-inflammatory and can cause acute lung injury ( 10, 11). The other arm, the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2)-Ang–(1-7)-Mas receptor (MasR) pathway is anti-inflammatory because ACE2 metabolizes Ang II, thus reducing its levels and converting it to the anti-inflammatory peptide, Ang–(1-7) [ Figure 1A, ( 2, 12)].
